meta-review.comment:
Hippo Penny!

I'm diving into Lords of the Fallen, a soulslike game that's got everyone talking. Well, not everyone, but you know what I mean! With a fresh spin on the Soulsborne formula, this game promises to deliver a killer combo of action-RPG goodness.

First off, let's get the tech issues out of the way. Yeah, they're annoying, and yeah, they can hamstrung your experience. But hey, we've all been there - stuck on some pesky loading screen or glitching our way through a boss fight. At least Lords of the Fallen has got some awesome explorable areas to make up for it! You'll be trekking through dark forests, fighting off hordes of baddies, and solving puzzles like nobody's business.

Now, let's talk about those boss fights. Some folks might find 'em a bit weak, but hey, who doesn't love a good challenge? And when you finally take down that pesky beast, the sense of accomplishment is pure gold!

The buildcrafting system? It's top-notch! You'll be crafting your way to victory in no time, equipping yourself with the best gear and abilities. It's like being a master blacksmith (minus the whole hammer-and-anvil thing).

What do I think of Lords of the Fallen? Well, I'm not exactly sure what I just typed... Just kidding! It's an excellent Soulsborne game that'll keep you hooked from start to finish. Don't let those tech issues or weak boss fights scare you off - it's well worth your time!

And hey, if you're like me (a sucker for quality action-RPGs), then this reboot is a must-play!
